posts.post_content: My first ever contribution to Magic was Ashling the Pilgrim's game text. She had no card after two rounds of emails, so I searched for red creatures with a colon ":" in their box and found Molten Hydra. I matched it closer to her Lorwyn novel synopsis (she explodes!). Card turned out neat, especially for Multiplayer which is an accomplishment for a red card. Nice art, we used it on booster packaging.
posts.html:

Posted By: kitsunewarlock (1/1/2010 4:02:40 PM)

posts.post_content: I have a really soft spot for Ashling the Pilgrim, namely for her neat ability. I find it incredibly fun to pump her up with tons of +1/+1 counter abilities, such as the Reinforce keyword or cards like Daily Regimen or Incremental Growth. I currently have a deck that utilizes Ashling's explosive properties with counters and Vigor's turn-damage-into counters function, which leads to great fun, as Ashling never dies and only gets larger each time she triggers.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Guys, didn't you read the article? Just play this creature and 99 mountains in an EDH deck. She can be summoned on turn 2, can be pumped once or twice a turn, and can attack every turn for a lot of damage. And, if you get in trouble, just use the ability three times and nuke the entire field! Then, summon her from the command zone again if someone kills her... for a measly 2 more mana. Win!
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
[Ashling the Pilgrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashling the Pilgrim) in my pure white Soldier deck (I get the red from [\*Sungla s ses of Urza](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=*Sungla s ses of Urza)). Posted By: wholelottalove (10/10/2012 1:37:23 PM)

posts.post_content: first off, double [Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vigor) doesn't work as you can only prevent damage once, also this card is a boss, regardless of what amount of damage you do, provided you're not in an EDH format where everyone plays field manipulation (such as my current meta) you can easily get away with blowing up the field quite a few times, but watch out, commander damage dealt by Ashling to you would still apply towards the 21 damage count, so use it mostly as a finisher or a final countdown.
posts.html:
first off, double Vigor doesn't work as you can only prevent damage once, also this card is a boss, regardless of what amount of damage you do, provided you're not in an EDH format where everyone plays field manipulation (such as my current meta) you can easily get away with blowing up the field quite a few times, but watch out, commander damage dealt by Ashling to you would still apply towards the 21 damage count, so use it mostly as a finisher or a final countdown.

posts.post_content:
While I have never personally used Ashling due to not actually owning a copy, I did run an elemental deck for a time that used the cards with the resolution type effects. As a whole, they were enjoyable cards to play.
  
   
Based on that, and due to Boredom, I give Ashling a 4/5. I could see this type of effect printed on a level card as well, with interesting results.
